data.title: WikiTree FREE Family Tree
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Ralph Verney born 1509 Tring, Hertfordshire, England died 1546 Aldbury, Hertfordshire, England including ancestors + descendants + 2 photos + 2 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 24 Jul 2021 | Created 11 Jun 2013

This page has been accessed 2,812 times.

Biography

"...After the death of Sir Ralph Verney, it was found by an inquisition (17 Henry VIII)... that Ralph Verney made his will, 8 May 1525, and died, the same day, leaving by Margaret Iwardby, his first wife, 'Ralph Verney, son and heir both of his father and his mother, aged 15 years and a half and upwards.'"[1]

In 1572, Edmond Verney (the younger) told the visiting Herald that he was the son of Sir Ralph Verney, knt., of Penley, by Elizabeth, sister and coheir of John, Lord Bray; and that Sir Ralph Verney was the son of another Sir Ralph Verney, by his first wife Margaret, daughter and co-heir of Inwardby of Quinton Mallet, co. Bucks.[2]

"The Verney family can be traced in Buckinghamshire from the 13th century, but its earliest property at Middle Claydon was acquired by the first Sir Ralph Verney about 1467 and the house at Pendley across the Hertfordshire border by his son Sir John. Thereafter the family continued to prosper although its successive heads were short-lived; the fourth Sir Ralph was 37 when he died in April 1546 leaving the 18 year-old Edmund as the eldest of his ten children." This eldest son Edmund died in December 1558 and was succeeded by Ralph Verney's fourth son, also named Edmund (as the younger Edmund's elder brothers John and Francis had already died childless).[3]

Children:

Edmund (the elder) Verney 1529–1558. (no children)

Francis Verney 1531-1559. (no children)

John Verney 1533–1557. (no children)

Ann Poyntz nee Verney 1535–1575 (Not to be confused with Ann Grey nee Verney)

Edmund (the younger) Verney Sir 1537–1599

Jane Verney 1540– (married Sir Francis Hynde)

Richard Verney 1540–

Ralph Verney 1541–

Urian Verney 1543–

Magna Carta ancestry

Ralph Verney is descended, through his mother's great-grandmother Katherine Missenden (see details on her profile), from Robert FitzWalter the leader of the Magna Carta surety barons, as well as surety barons Henry de Bohun, Hugh le Bigod, his father Roger le Bigod, and Richard de Clare.

Sources

↑ George Lipscomb, The History and Antiquities of the County of Buckingham, Volume 1 (1847), p. 181.

↑ The visitations of Hertfordshire : made by Robert Cooke, esq.,Clarencieux, in 1572, and Sir Richard St. George, kt., Clarencieux, in 1634, with Hertfordshire pedigrees from Harleian mss. 6147 and 1546 (1886), p. 23.

↑ J.S. Roskell, "VERNEY, Edmund (1528-58), of Pendley in Tring, Herts.," in History of Parliament Online."

Verney Pedigree

Published in The History of Parliament: the House of Commons 1509-1558, ed. S.T. Bindoff, 1982

Available from Boydell and Brewer

Ref Volumes: 1509-1558 Author: M. K. Dale Notes 1. Date of birth given in fa.’s i.p.m., C142/74/2. Vis. Bucks. ed. Metcalfe, 10; Verney Pprs. (Cam. Soc. lvi), 57, 67; CPR, 1555-7, p. 88. 2.Verney Pprs. pp. xiv, 12-57, 79; VCH Bucks. iv. 33; CPR, 1547-8, p. 249; 1548-9, p. 339; 1550-3, p. 216; 1554-5, p. 287; 1555-7, p. 88; Browne Willis, Bucks. 154; Wards 9/149, f. 160; 9/153, Bucks. 38 Hen. VIII. 3.CSP Dom. 1547-80, p. 9; HMC 2nd Rep. 101-2; HMC 3rd Rep. 239; CSP For. 1547-53, p. 123; APC, iii. 259; iv. 416; CPR, 1553-4, p. 444. 4. Guildford mus. Loseley 1331/2; Verney Pprs. 72-73; CPR, 1555-7, p. 539; 1554-8, pp. 81-82; D. M. Loades, Two Tudor Conspiracies, 210-35 passim, 267. 5.CPR, 1558-60, p. 73; E150/51/10; Verney Pprs. 78.

See also:

Benolte, Thomas; Philipot, John; & Owen, George. The Visitations of the County of Sussex: 1530 and 1633-4. London: The Harleian Society, 1905. Vol LIII, p 20.
